1.text: My son, forget not my law, and let thy heart keep my commandments.

2.text: For they shall add to thee length of days, and years of life and peace.

3.text: Let not mercy and truth leave thee, put them about thy neck, and write them in the tables of thy heart:

4.text: And thou shalt And grace and good understanding before God and men.

5.text: Have confidence in the Lord with all thy heart, and lean not upon thy own prudence.

6.text: In all thy ways think on him, and he will direct thy steps.

7.text: Be not wise in thy own conceit: fear God, and depart from evil:

8.text: For it shall be health to thy navel, and moistening to thy bones.

9.text: Honour the Lord with thy substance, and give him of the first of all thy fruits :

10.text: And thy barns shall be filled with abundance, and thy presses shall run over with wine.

11.text: My son, reject not the correction of the Lord: and do not faint when thou art chastised by him:

12.text: For whom the Lord loveth, he chastiseth: and as a father in the son he pleaseth himself.

13.text: Blessed is the man that findeth wisdom and is rich in prudence:

14.text: The purchasing thereof is better than the merchandise of silver, and her fruit than the chiefest and purest gold:

15.text: She is more precious than all riches : and all the things that are desired, are not to be compared with her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right hand, and in her left hand riches and glory.

17.text: Her ways are beautiful ways, and all her paths are peaceable.

18.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold on her: and he that shall retain her is blessed.

19.text: The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth, hath established the heavens by prudence.

20.text: By his wisdom the depths have broken out, and the clouds grow thick with dew

21.text: My son, let not these things depart from thy eyes: keep the law and counsel:

22.text: And there shall be life to thy soul, and grace to thy mouth.

23.text: Then shalt thou walk confidently in thy way, and thy foot shall not stumble:

24.text: If thou sleep, thou shalt not fear: thou shalt rest, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, nor of the power of the wicked falling upon thee.

26.text: For the Lord will be at thy side, and will keep thy foot that thou be not taken.

27.text: Do not withhold him from doing good, who is able: if thou art able, do good thyself also.

28.text: Say not to thy friend: Go, and come again: and to morrow I will give to thee: when thou canst give at present.

29.text: Practise not evil against thy friend, when he hath confidence in thee.

30.text: Strive not against a man without cause, when he hath done thee no evil.

31.text: Envy not the unjust man, and do not follow his ways:

32.text: For every mocker is an abomination to the Lord, and his communication is with the simple.

33.text: Want is from the Lord in the house of the wicked: but the habitations of the just shall be blessed.

34.text: He shall scorn the scorners, and to the meek he will give grace.

35.text: The wise shall possess glory: the promotion of fools is disgrace.
